Title: Data Scientist, Legal and Compliance Division
JD:
About the job
    


          Company Profile
Morgan Stanley is a leading global financial services firm providing a wide range of investment banking, securities, investment management and wealth management services. The Firm's employees serve clients worldwide including corporations, governments and individuals from more than 1,200 offices in 43 countries.
As a market leader, the talent and passion of our people is critical to our success. Together, we share a common set of values rooted in integrity, excellence and strong team ethic. Morgan Stanley can provide a superior foundation for building a professional career - a place for people to learn, to achieve and grow. A philosophy that balances personal lifestyles, perspectives and needs is an important part of our culture.
Department Profile
Professionals within the Legal and Compliance Division (LCD) provide a wide range of services to our business units. They might help to structure a complex and sensitive cross-border transaction; advise on a new product introduction; develop a training program or defuse an investor dispute. They preserve the firm's invaluable reputation for integrity and protect the firm from sanctions with policies and procedures that meet regulatory requirements around the world. They also strive to maintain cooperative relationships with governmental policy makers and the regulatory and self-regulatory agencies that govern the firm's businesses.
Data & Analytics is a function in the Legal and Compliance Division responsible for designing and optimizing surveillance models, approaches and tools using advanced analytical techniques like supervised and unsupervised machine learning, Natural Language Processing (NLP) and evolving techniques like reinforcement and deep learning as well as graph analytics. The surveillances and other tools help identify suspicious and/or illegal behaviors like money laundering, market manipulation, insider trading, unfair sales or trading practices and other financial crimes.
Primary Responsibilities
 Development of Risk models leveraging Machine learning and related quantitative techniques to improve surveillance and compliance monitoring activities Develop and implement new risk identification strategies including graph-based approaches, graph analytics infrastructure and data sourcing efforts Undertake research efforts to identify novel methods to deliver efficiency and effectiveness across analytical solutions Work with stakeholders of the Financial Crimes, Compliance, Legal and IT departments to champion the adoption of new AI and ML approaches, techniques and capabilities
Required Skills
 Master's Degree in Computer Science, Machine Learning, Statistics, Mathematics, Engineering or other highly quantitative field. PhD preferred 4-7 years hands-on industry experience in building supervised and unsupervised machine learning based solutions and applied statistical analysis to solve complex business problems Knowledge of software design principles and excellent skills in one or more programming languages including Python, R, Java, Scala Ability to work with and mentor a global team balancing multiple projects Strong problem solving and project management skills Excellent written and oral communication skills
Preferred Skills
 Familiarity with Financial Markets, with an emphasis on Financial Crimes, Compliance or Fraud analytics.Experience with graph and network analytics packages such as NetworkX or Neo4J Experience with deep learning frameworks including PyTorch or Tensorflow Experience with big data tools such as Hadoop & cloud computing, such as PySpark and cloud machine learning tools.
Posting Date
Apr 11, 2022
Primary Location
Americas-United States of America-New York-New York
Education Level
Master's Degree
Job

Employment Type
Full Time
Job Level

Title: AVP - Data Science
JD:
About the job
    


          Morgan Stanley is a leading global financial services firm providing a wide range of investment banking, securities, investment management and wealth management services. The Firm's employees serve clients worldwide including corporations, governments, and individuals from more than 1,200 offices in 43 countries.
As a market leader, the talent and passion of our people is critical to our success. Together, we share a common set of values rooted in integrity, excellence, and strong team ethic. Morgan Stanley can provide a superior foundation for building a professional career - a place for people to learn, to achieve and grow. A philosophy that balances personal lifestyles, perspectives and needs is an important part of our culture.
The Analytics & Data Organization is part of Morgan Stanley’s Wealth Management Division. The organization’s responsibility is to support Wealth Management’s strategic objectives through the use and exploitation of its data and analytical assets. Key focus areas will be in support of organic growth through the digitization and delivery of investment advice; partnering with each business area by providing them the tools, expertise, and support for them to understand and analyze their own data; and to make data and analytics a differentiated capability for the firm.
Morgan Stanley is currently searching for AVP, Data Science. This role will directly report to the Executive Director, Data Science in Enterprise Data & Analytics (EDA) organization. The person will work on data science use-cases for the enterprise and must have deep expertise in supervised and unsupervised machine learning, modeling and algorithms with a strong focus on delivering use-cases and solutions at speed and scale to solve business problems. The person must have ability to learn at rapid pace, develop strong business acumen with the ability to collaborate with multiple stakeholders across the enterprise - marketing, digital, product, sales & service, EDA, finance, and technology to drive business results
Job Responsibilities
-Leverage AI/ML modeling and algorithms to deliver on use cases for the Retail Growth plan across marketing, targeting, digital and products strategy -Build modeling solutions at speed and scale to solve business problems -Lead the development of data science and modeling capabilities in the cloud transformation journey -Develop data science solutions that can be tested and deployed to enable data-driven recommendations and outcomes -Implement and scale-up high-availability models and algorithms for various business and corporate functions -Investigate and create experimental prototypes that work on specific domains and verticals -Analyze large, complex data sets to reveal underlying patterns, correlations, and trends quantitatively -Support and enhance existing models to ensure better performance -Set up and conduct large-scale experiments to test hypotheses and drive business growth -Degree (Graduate / Ph.D. preferred) in an analytical or technical field (e.g. applied mathematics, physics, computer science, operations research) -Advanced knowledge of statistical and machine learning methods, particularly in the areas of modeling -Hands on experience on building models at speed and scale -Strategic thinker and influencer with demonstrated leadership acumen and problem-solving skills -Ability to work in a collaborative, transparent style with cross-functional stakeholders across the organization to lead and deliver results -Strong skills in oral and written communication including experience in effectively communicating with executives, employees, colleagues, and clients -Ability to lead a high-functioning team and develop and train people -8+ years of experience programming in SQL, and Python and R -8+ years of experience working with relational databases and distributed computing platforms and their query interfaces -Experience conceiving, implementing and continually improving machine learning projects -Strong familiarity with higher level trends in artificial intelligence and open-source platforms -Experience working with AWS, Azure, or similar cloud platform Familiarity with visualization techniques and software 
This role requires that all successful applicants be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 as a condition of employment and provide proof of such vaccinations within 3 days of commencement of employment

Title: Java Developer (Big Data)
JD:
About the job
    


          MS Investment Management Technology (IMIT)
Morgan Stanley Investment Management Technology exclusively partners with the Morgan Stanley Investment Management business division to design and develop systems and integrate vendor products to globally support full life cycle business processing. Activities include Portfolio Analysis, Risk, Trading, Operations, and Sales & Marketing. Morgan Stanley Investment Management (MSIM) Technology also provides holistic support and quality assurance across the suite of applications used in the MSIM environment.
Opportunity with the team
Morgan Stanley is seeking a full stack developer to join the Fixed Income Front Office Technology team. The individual will work as part of the global development team, which is spread across 2 MSIM sites. The individual will help the team design, develop a modern technology stack to power our digital platforms aimed unlocking efficiencies for our Investment Teams, Quants and traders. As a front office developer, the individual will also work closely with the Fixed Income front office team to solve operational problems and design strategic solutions to offer best class technology solutions to our Investment teams. The Full Stack Java Developer will support the core quant group in the Fixed Income & Liquidity business working on infrastructure at the interface of investment decision-making and automated trading. The quant group develops new tools and services, interacting directly with the research team, the portfolio managers, and the traders to capture business requirements, to translate them into technological solutions and to integrate these solutions into the production environment.
Primary Duties And Responsibilities
 Designing Applications including User Interfaces and APIs Build and maintain high-performance, scalable systems Identify, design and implement process improvements that automate manual processes to achieve scalability and cost-reduction Work across all aspects of the product life cycle: design, development, deployment and end-user support. Designing and develop applications using technologies mentioned below Participating in our agile ceremonies and actively driving towards the team's goals. Working independently using modern software development practices. Working collaboratively with a global team of technologists and Fixed income Quant group. Leading with ideas and innovation. Managing communication and partnering with our end users to design solutions.
Education
Required Education, Qualifications, and Key Skills:
 Degree in Computer Science or in a typical STEM field, such as Engineering or Mathematics
Experience
 Experience in UI development using React Experience in Java Spring boot and related technology  Must be familiar with Java 8 and higher
Required Skills
 Strong understanding and familiarity working in the Linux operating environment Familiarity with build automation and continuous integration tools, Maven, Gradle and Jenkins Experience working with microservices and distributed systems. Experience working directly with end users. Understanding of Fixed Income financial markets Strong computer science fundamentals. Experience writing unit, component and integration tests At least 5+ years of experience
Additional Skills
 Knowledge of Spring Cloud Knowledge of Scala Knowledge of FDC3 integration with OpenFin, FinSemble or Glue42

Try Premium for freeActively recruiting     Apply         Save            Save VP/AVP - Model Oversight, Data Science at Morgan Stanley
Title: VP/AVP - Model Oversight, Data Science
JD:
About the job
    


          Morgan Stanley is a leading global financial services firm providing a wide range of investment banking, securities, investment management and wealth management services. The Firm's employees serve clients worldwide including corporations, governments, and individuals from more than 1,200 offices in 43 countries.
As a market leader, the talent and passion of our people is critical to our success. Together, we share a common set of values rooted in integrity, excellence, and strong team ethic. Morgan Stanley can provide a superior foundation for building a professional career - a place for people to learn, to achieve and grow. A philosophy that balances personal lifestyles, perspectives and needs is an important part of our culture.
Job Description
The Analytics & Data Organization is part of Morgan Stanley’s Wealth Management Division. The organization’s responsibility is to support Wealth Management’s strategic objectives through the use and exploitation of its data and analytical assets. Key focus areas will be in support of organic growth through the digitization and delivery of investment advice; partnering with each business area by providing them the tools, expertise, and support for them to understand and analyze their own data; and to make data and analytics a differentiated capability for the firm.
Morgan Stanley is currently searching for VP, Model Oversight, Data Science. This role will directly report to the Executive Director, Data Science in Analytics, Modeling and Data (AMD) organization. The person will play critical role in identifying model risk, drive standardization and collaborate with 2nd line of defense. This person will lead designing model governance process and control for end-to-end model life cycle for entire portfolio of wealth management models covering sales, marketing, media, and field management. This person will work with data scientists who are working on AI/ML modeling use case and provide thought leadership for continuous model governance enhancements and innovation. This person will lead executive communication to support key business initiatives from modeling perspective.
This person will regularly collaborate with model risk, compliance, legal and other business stakeholders. This person will work with model risk to ensure collaboration on model planning, and adhere to high standards of validation, and monitoring. This person will partner with legal and compliance to ensure adherence to policies and lead required testing such as fairness/bias.
As a lead for managing model oversight for the enterprise, this person must have deep expertise in supervised and unsupervised machine learning, modeling, and algorithms with a strong focus on communicating use-cases and solutions to business partners. The person must have ability to learn at rapid pace, develop strong business acumen with the ability to collaborate with multiple stakeholders across first and second line across the enterprise. This person must have deep experience of working in model oversight function and managed model validation process.
Job Responsibilities
Design model governance process and control for end-to-end model life cycle for entire portfolio of wealth management models covering sales, marketing, media, and field managementProvide thought leadership and create action plan to elevate standards of governance for AI/ML models.Act as a liaison between modeling, business stakeholders and 2nd line of governance- Risk, Legal and compliance. Collaborate with modeling team, model risk team, business unit partners, and other stakeholders to continuously enhance the model governance program and help drive compliance with policyDevelop and maintain training material for various model governance audiencesRepresent modeling on teams and task groups for projects/initiatives across the organization and act as a source of effective challengePerform outreach activities to new business areas engaged in modelingDevelop and maintain business unit and enterprise-wide model risk metrics and reportsDevelop and maintain model repository, develop model scorecard, and communicate model impact to senior leadersLead building out action plans and milestones to drive remediation of any oversight issuesLead Modeling team’s communication for regulatory examsDrive knowledge sharing on relevant industry standards, best practices, and business processes and technology used in model risk management and model development.Lead evaluation of model management technology tools 
This role requires that all successful applicants be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 as a condition of employment and provide proof of such vaccinations within 3 days of commencement of employment
Degree (Graduate / Ph.D. preferred) in an analytical or technical field (e.g. applied mathematics, physics, computer science, operations research) Advanced knowledge of statistical and machine learning methods, particularly in the areas of modeling Hands on experience on building models at speed and scale.A minimum of 3 years of experience working in model oversight functions Strategic thinker and influencer with demonstrated leadership acumen and problem-solving skillsAbility to work in a collaborative, transparent style with cross-functional stakeholders across the organization to lead and deliver results Strong skills in oral and written communication including experience in effectively communicating with executives, employees, colleagues, and clients Ability to lead a high-functioning team and develop and train people A minimum of 8 years of experience programming in SQL, and Python and R A minimum of 8 years of experience working with relational databases and distributed computing platforms and their query interfaces Experience conceiving, implementing and continually improving machine learning projectsStrong familiarity with higher level trends in artificial intelligence and open-source platforms Experience working with AWS, Azure, or similar cloud platform Familiarity with visualization techniques and software
